citation.case_name: Osbourne v. Mississippi Valley Barge Line Co.

html:
389 U.S. 579

88 S.Ct. 692

19 L.Ed.2d 779

Edmund D. OSBOURNE et al.
v.
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY BARGE LINE CO. et al.

No. 768.

Supreme Court of the United States

October Term, 1967.

January 15, 1968

Rehearing Denied March 4, 1968.

See 390 U.S. 975, 88 S.Ct. 1024.

John L. Laubach, Jr., for appellants Osbourne and others.

Arthur L. Winn, Jr., Samuel H. Moerman, J. Raymond Clark and James M. Henderson, for appellees Mississippi Valley Barge Line Co. and others.

Solicitor General Griswold, Assistant Attorney General Turner, Robert W. Ginnane and Fritz R. Kahn, for appellees United States and others.

PER CURIAM.

1

The motions to affirm are granted and judgment is affirmed without prejudice to the presentation of an appropriate motion in the United States District Court for the Eastern District of Missouri for a modification of the injunction.
html_lawbox:
389 U.S. 579 (1968)

OSBOURNE ET AL.
v.
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY BARGE LINE CO. ET AL.

No. 768.

Supreme Court of United States.

Decided January 15, 1968.
APPEAL FROM THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE EASTERN DISTRICT OF MISSOURI.

John L. Laubach, Jr., for appellants Osbourne et al.

Arthur L. Winn, Jr., Samuel H. Moerman, J. Raymond Clark and James M. Henderson for Mississippi Valley Barge Line Co. et al., and Solicitor General Griswold, Assistant Attorney General Turner, Robert W. Ginnane and Fritz R. Kahn for the United States et al., appellees.

PER CURIAM.

The motions to affirm are granted and judgment is affirmed without prejudice to the presentation of an appropriate motion in the United States District Court for the Eastern District of Missouri for a modification of the injunction.
html_with_citations:
389 U.S. 579 (1968)

OSBOURNE ET AL.
v.
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY BARGE LINE CO. ET AL.

No. 768.

Supreme Court of United States.

Decided January 15, 1968.
APPEAL FROM THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE EASTERN DISTRICT OF MISSOURI.

John L. Laubach, Jr., for appellants Osbourne et al.

Arthur L. Winn, Jr., Samuel H. Moerman, J. Raymond Clark and James M. Henderson for Mississippi Valley Barge Line Co. et al., and Solicitor General Griswold, Assistant Attorney General Turner, Robert W. Ginnane and Fritz R. Kahn for the United States et al., appellees.

PER CURIAM.

The motions to affirm are granted and judgment is affirmed without prejudice to the presentation of an appropriate motion in the United States District Court for the Eastern District of Missouri for a modification of the injunction.
